component.name: StateTask
component.script:
sub init() logFunction("StateTask", "init") m.top.functionName = "loop" m.hold = 500 end sub
function loop() as void while true logFunction("StateTask", "loop")
print "queue before next loop" + formatJson(m.top.queue)
if m.top.queue.count() < 1 then sleep(m.hold) else q = m.top.queue event = q.shift() m.top.queue = q
if event.type = "count" then count() else if event.type = "refresh_ip" then refreshIp() end if
' TODO: Remove this when not testing sleep(m.hold) end if end while end function
function queue(event) as void logFunction("StateTask", "queue", [ event ]) q = m.top.queue q.push(event) m.top.queue = q end function
function count() as void logFunction("StateTask", "count") m.top.index = m.top.index + 1 end function
function refreshIp() as void logFunction("StateTask", "refreshIp")
url = "https://helloacm.com/api/random/?n=128" print "curl -X GET " + url http = createObject("roUrlTransfer") http.SetCertificatesFile("common:/certs/ca-bundle.crt") http.AddHeader("X-Roku-Reserved-Dev-Id", "") http.InitClientCertificates() http.setPort(createObject("roMessagePort")) http.setUrl("https://httpbin.org/ip") http.addHeader("Content-Type", "application/json") http.asyncGetToString() event = wait(30000, http.getPort()) if event = invalid then print "Timed out on " + url ' Guess there was no answer ' Either the network shit the bed or the server shit the bed else if type(event) = "roUrlEvent" then code = event.getResponseCode() body = event.getString() print url + " response => code: " + stri(code) + " body: " + body if code = 200 then m.top.ip = parseJson(body) print "Parsed the JSON" else ' Well shit, something went wrong end if end if end function
